clinical_study.brief_title: CHAIN_brazilian Registry of Congenital HeArt Disease INtervention and Angiography
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 0 _ Brazilian Registry of Congenital HeArt Disease INtervention and Angiography

collaborator.agency: Netherlands: Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sports

oversight_info.authority: Brazil: HCor's IRB (the study is a registry, there is no Drugs and Medicinal Devices)

brief_summary.textblock: Design: Observational - Cross study with followed up for 30 days. The Primary Objective is to realize a record that reflects a national overview of the role of cardiac catheterization in patients with congenital heart disease in hospitals distributed by geographic density of each region of Brazil.

detailed_description.textblock: Patients admitted in the hemodynamic sector with diagnosed or suspected congenital cardiopathy and undergoing diagnostic or therapeutic cardiac catheterization. Participants release the data in (e-CRF) electronics system. Sample: 2000 records.

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of serious complications of cardiac catheterization in congenital heart
primary_outcome.description: Occurrence of serious complications of cardiac catheterization in congenital heart procedure-related (occurring within 7 days after the procedure or until hospital discharge, whichever occurs first, and following 30 days), such as embolization of the prosthesis, cardiac arrhythmias, trauma vascular intracardiac injury, death, etc

study_pop.textblock: Patients admitted to the hemodynamic sector with diagnosed or suspected congenital cardiopathy and undergoing diagnostic or therapeutic cardiac catheterization.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients admitted to the hemodynamic sector with diagnosed or suspected congenital cardiopathy and undergoing diagnostic or therapeutic cardiac catheterization.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing hybrid approach to intervention, with the aid of cardiac surgery to realization of cardiac catheterization.
